motto: Dominus Illuminatio Mea (The Lord is my Light)

admissions.overview: Oxford admissions are highly competitive. Applications open from September and close in mid-October.
admissions.requirements: Applicants must meet A-Level or IB requirements. Additional entrance exams may be required for some courses.
admissions.important_dates: Application deadline: Mid-October | Interviews: December | Decisions: January
admissions.how_to_apply: Undergraduate applications go through UCAS. Postgraduate applications are submitted via the university portal.

housing.description: Oxford offers on-campus accommodation for all first-year students and many postgraduate students.

campus_life.student_societies: Over 400 student societies, including debating, music, and drama clubs.

postgraduate.range: Varies by program; ranges from £20,000 to £50,000 per year
postgraduate.research_programs: Some programs offer funded research positions.

scholarships.name: Rhodes Scholarship
scholarships.description: Covers full tuition and living expenses for international students.

scholarships.name: Clarendon Scholarship
scholarships.description: Available for outstanding postgraduate applicants across all disciplines.

latest_breakthroughs: Advances in AI ethics and governance

career_services.career_guidance: Oxford provides career counseling, resume workshops, and employer networking events.
career_services.internships: Students can apply for paid internships through the Oxford Careers Service.
career_services.entrepreneurship: The Oxford Foundry supports student startups and business incubation.

contact.address: University of Oxford, Oxford OX1 2JD, United Kingdom
